intro: Luzula hawaiiensis var. hawaiiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sedge, is a rare plant native to the island of Hawaii. It is a perennial herb with grass-like leaves that are typically narrow and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically greenish or brownish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in streamside habitats or along forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
